content.title: Conversation
table: Arman: Do animals talk to each other?
آرمان: حیوانات با هم حرف می‌زنند؟
Parsa: Yes, thay talk to each other.
پارسا: آره، آنها با هم حرف می‌زنند.
Arman: What do they talk about?
آرمان: در مورد چی حرف می‌زنند؟
Parsa: Thay talk about other animals.
پارسا: آنها در مورد دیگر حیوانات حرف می‌زنند.
Arman: What else do they talk about?
آرمان: دیگر در مورد چه چیزی حرف می‌زنند؟
Parsa: They talk about food and the weather.
پارسا: آنها در مورد غذا و آب و هوا حرف می‌زنند.
Arman: What do they say about us?
آرمان: آنها در مورد ما چه چیزی می‌گویند؟
Parsa: They say that we look funny.
پارسا: آنها می‌گویند قیافه ما خنده‌دار است.

content.title: Grammar
table: She may have written a letter
A letter may have been written

content.title: Common Phrases
table: Where do I buy a ticket?

content.title: Conversation
table: Arash: Have you shown your dog to a vet?
آرش: سگ خود را به دامپزشک نشان داده‌ای؟
Pedram: Yes my dog has fleas.
پدرام: بله سگ من شپش دارد.
Arash: Your dog had to go into quarantine.
آرش: تو باید سگ خود را قرنطینه کنی.
Pedram: No, the doctor has prescribed shampoos.
پدرام: نه دکتر شامپو تجویز کرده است.

content.title: Reading
content.description: Valiasr street is the longest street in Tehran. It is even the longest street in the Middle East. In the past, this beautiful street was named Pahlavi Street. The street starts from Rahahan Square and reaches all the way to Tajrish square. This street is the most beautiful street in Tehran. There are about eleven thousand plane trees on this street. Shopping centres, famous restaurants and museums are located along this street.
